about.para1: It consists of the protection of a conceived child, whose name only God knows, through daily prayer for nine months.
about.para2: We support the right to life from conception to natural death, following the teachings of faith and reparation requested by Our Lady of Fatima.

whatIs.title: What is Spiritual Adoption?
whatIs.description: Spiritual Adoption is living spiritual motherhood and fatherhood in relation to children threatened by abortion.

1.title: 9 famous people who escaped abortion
1.description: They were targets of abortion; but because they escaped and had the opportunity to be born, they could realize their own talents.

2.title: Padre Pio made a woman see the Pope she aborted
2.description: The child you killed in your womb with abortion, in God's designs, was meant to become this pope.

3.title: Moving testimony of a Priest who was almost aborted
3.description: Testimony of Father Matheus Aquino, from the Archdiocese of São Sebastião do Rio de Janeiro.

4.title: Her grandmother forced her mother to abort, but she survived
4.description: In the eighth month of pregnancy she was forced to abort against her will. But the child growing in her womb had a purpose in life, beyond death.

5.title: Man has already adopted over 100 children who would have been aborted
5.description: Vietnamese Tong Phuoc Phuc is another wonderful example of real-life heroes! If it weren't for him, over a hundred children would have been aborted in his country.

intro.title: What is Spiritual Adoption?
intro.text: Spiritual Adoption is the exercise of spiritual motherhood and fatherhood with children threatened by abortion. Imagine that somewhere that only God knows, a child has emerged who is not being expected. When the parents discover its existence, they will be frightened and consider abortion as a solution. Be the spiritual mother or father of this child. Welcome it with your affection and love through a brief daily prayer for 9 months.

howToParticipate.title: How to participate?
howToParticipate.description: Participation in Spiritual Adoption begins with the intention to spiritually care for a child that only God knows, threatened by abortion, their mother, and their family.

whoIsItFor.title: Who do we recommend Spiritual Adoption for
whoIsItFor.description: Women who have gone through the experience of abortion, for the elderly, for young people, for children and for couples who cannot have their own children

patrons.title: Meet Our Patrons
patrons.description: Get to know the saints and blesseds who inspire our mission in defense of life.

guadalupe.name: Our Lady of Guadalupe
guadalupe.description: Patroness of the Americas and protector of the unborn

ulma.name: Ulma Family
ulma.description: Blessed martyrs in defense of life

stories.title: Inspirational Stories
stories.description: Discover beautiful stories in defense of life.

partners.title: Our Partners
partners.description: Meet those who walk with us in this mission.

formation.title: Formation
formation.description: Learn more about the theme of defending life.

step1.title: Holy Rosary
step1.text: Pray one of the mysteries of the Rosary (one decade) every day for nine months.

step2.title: Special Prayer
step2.text: "Lord Jesus, I ask You for this conceived child, spiritually adopted by me, who is in danger of being killed by abortion..."

step3.title: Additional Action
step3.text: Spontaneously add a daily purpose, such as a small sacrifice or good deed.

q1.question: Who can participate in Spiritual Adoption?
q1.answer: Anyone: laypeople, religious, children, youth, and adults. All it takes is the desire to save a life through prayer.

q2.question: Can I adopt more than one child at a time?
q2.answer: The rule recommends adopting one child at a time, so that the commitment is lived with fidelity during the 9 months.

q3.question: What should I do if I forget to pray one day?
q3.answer: It is not a sin, but prolonged forgetting interrupts the Adoption. If you forget one day, continue normally the next day. If you forget for a long time, the commitment should be restarted.

q4.question: How to choose the child's name?
q4.answer: You don't need to choose a name, as God already knows them. But if you wish, you can give a symbolic name to facilitate your prayer.

slide1.title: Spiritually adopt a child.
slide1.text: Protect a life in danger of being interrupted by abortion through daily prayer for nine months.

slide2.title: Prayer that saves lives.
slide2.text: Thousands of children have already been saved through people who committed to daily prayer.

slide3.title: An act of love for others.
slide3.text: Spiritual adoption does not require financial resources, only your time and your heart focused on God.

brand.desc: A prayer movement in defense of the unborn, protecting life from conception.

news1.desc: Check out what the latest Popes said about the importance of defending life from conception.

news2.desc: Moving stories of people who say yes to life even amidst the difficulties of pregnancy.

news3.title: In Defense of Life

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Your privacy is important to us.
privacy.p1: It is Spiritual Adoption's policy to respect your privacy regarding any information we may collect from you across our website, Spiritual Adoption, and other sites we own and operate. We only ask for personal information when we truly need it to provide a service to you. We collect it by fair and lawful means, with your knowledge and consent. We also let you know why we’re collecting it and how it will be used.
privacy.p2: We only retain collected information for as long as necessary to provide you with your requested service. What data we store, we’ll protect within commercially acceptable means to prevent loss and theft, as well as unauthorized access, disclosure, copying, use or modification.
privacy.p3: We don’t share any personally identifying information publicly or with third-parties, except when required to by law.
privacy.p4: Our website may link to external sites that are not operated by us. Please be aware that we have no control over the content and practices of these sites, and cannot accept responsibility or liability for their respective privacy policies.
privacy.p5: You are free to refuse our request for your personal information, with the understanding that we may be unable to provide you with some of your desired services.
privacy.p6: Your continued use of our website will be regarded as acceptance of our practices around privacy and personal information. If you have any questions about how we handle user data and personal information, feel free to contact us.

cookies.title: Spiritual Adoption Cookie Policy
cookies.what_text: As is common practice with almost all professional websites this site uses cookies, which are tiny files that are downloaded to your computer, to improve your experience. This page describes what information they gather, how we use it and why we sometimes need to store these cookies. We will also share how you can prevent these cookies from being stored however this may downgrade or 'break' certain elements of the sites functionality.
cookies.how_text: We use cookies for a variety of reasons detailed below. Unfortunately in most cases there are no industry standard options for disabling cookies without completely disabling the functionality and features they add to this site. It is recommended that you leave on all cookies if you are not sure whether you need them or not in case they are used to provide a service that you use.
cookies.disable_text: You can prevent the setting of cookies by adjusting the settings on your browser (see your browser Help for how to do this). Be aware that disabling cookies will affect the functionality of this and many other websites that you visit. Disabling cookies will usually result in also disabling certain functionality and features of the this site. Therefore it is recommended that you do not disable cookies.
cookies.account: Account related cookies If you create an account with us then we will use cookies for the management of the signup process and general administration. These cookies will usually be deleted when you log out however in some cases they may remain afterwards to remember your site preferences when logged out.
cookies.login: Login related cookies We use cookies when you are logged in so that we can remember this fact. This prevents you from having to log in every single time you visit a new page. These cookies are typically removed or cleared when you log out to ensure that you can only access restricted features and areas when logged in.
cookies.newsletter: Email newsletters related cookies This site offers newsletter or email subscription services and cookies may be used to remember if you are already registered and whether to show certain notifications which might only be valid to subscribed/unsubscribed users.
cookies.orders: Orders processing related cookies This site offers e-commerce or payment facilities and some cookies are essential to ensure that your order is remembered between pages so that we can process it properly.
cookies.surveys: Surveys related cookies From time to time we offer user surveys and questionnaires to provide you with interesting insights, helpful tools, or to understand our user base more accurately. These surveys may use cookies to remember who has already taken part in a survey or to provide you with accurate results after you change pages.
cookies.forms: Forms related cookies When you submit data to through a form such as those found on contact pages or comment forms cookies may be set to remember your user details for future correspondence.
cookies.preferences: Site preferences cookies In order to provide you with a great experience on this site we provide the functionality to set your preferences for how this site runs when you use it. In order to remember your preferences we need to set cookies so that this information can be called whenever you interact with a page is affected by your preferences.

third_party.title: Third Party Cookies
third_party.intro: In some special cases we also use cookies provided by trusted third parties. The following section details which third party cookies you might encounter through this site.
third_party.analytics: This site uses Google Analytics which is one of the most widespread and trusted analytics solution on the web for helping us to understand how you use the site and ways that we can improve your experience. These cookies may track things such as how long you spend on the site and the pages that you visit so we can continue to produce engaging content. For more information on Google Analytics cookies, see the official Google Analytics page.
third_party.third_party_analytics: Third party analytics are used to track and measure usage of this site so that we can continue to produce engaging content. These cookies may track things such as how long you spend on the site or pages you visit which helps us to understand how we can improve the site for you.
third_party.testing: From time to time we test new features and make subtle changes to the way that the site is delivered. When we are still testing new features these cookies may be used to ensure that you receive a consistent experience whilst on the site whilst ensuring we understand which optimisations our users appreciate the most.
third_party.ads: As we sell products it's important for us to understand statistics about how many of the visitors to our site actually make a purchase and as such this is the kind of data that these cookies will track. This is important to you as it means that we can accurately make business predictions that allow us to monitor our advertising and product costs to ensure the best possible price.

more_info.title: More Information
more_info.text: Hopefully that has clarified things for you and as was previously mentioned if there is something that you aren't sure whether you need or not it's usually safer to leave cookies enabled in case it does interact with one of the features you use on our site.

privacy.effective_date: This policy is effective as of October 2020.

famosos.title: 9 famous people who escaped abortion
famosos.intro: They were found by abortion; but because they escaped and had the opportunity to be born, they could realize other talents.
famosos.p1: We all have the right to be born; no matter how many mistakes someone may make, there is always a greater reason for that person to exist. It is always worth letting everyone perform their own show on this earth! Bearing this in mind, it is almost impossible to believe that the famous people below were almost not born. If that were the case, the world would not be the same without them!

jobs.title: Steve Jobs
jobs.text: Can you imagine your life without a Mac, iPhone or iPad? If Joanne Schieble, then 22, had given up on carrying her pregnancy to term, technology would not be as we know it today. Joanne, Steve Jobs' biological mother, got pregnant by her Syrian boyfriend and decided to put the baby up for adoption. She chose a family financially capable paying for the baby's college studies, but when the prospective parents found out Joanne was expecting a boy, they backed out because they wanted a girl. Joanne, about to give birth and with no time to look for a new family, eventually agreed to hand her son over to a humble couple. Jobs, in an interview, stated he was grateful for not having ended up in an abortion.

bieber.title: Justin Bieber
bieber.text: In her book “Nowhere But Up”, Pattie Mallette, Justin Bieber's mother, says that when she found herself pregnant at 17, she was pressured to have an abortion. But that was never an option: “I knew I couldn't do that,” she revealed in an interview. “The only thing I knew was that I had to keep the pregnancy. I didn't know how I was going to do it, but I just knew I couldn't abort,” she said. At 18, Pattie gave birth to Justin in Ontario (Canada) and raised him with the help of her parents Bruce and Diane, the singer's grandparents.

bolanos.title: Roberto Gómez Bolaños
bolanos.text: In a brief commercial in Mexico, Roberto Gómez Bolaños (known in Brazil for his acting as Chavo and Chapulín), revealed that when his mother was pregnant she suffered an accident where she almost died. The doctors then recommended she abort. “Abort, me? Never!” replied the mother. “She defended life, my life. It is thanks to her that I am here,” he stated.

boyle.title: Susan Boyle
boyle.text: When Bridget Boyle, at 45, got pregnant, doctors considered it a high-risk pregnancy and therefore advised her to abort. “But that was unthinkable for my mother, a devout Catholic. I am only here because she had faith,” said the British woman. During childbirth, an emergency C-section, Susan suffered lack of oxygen and was born underweight. Therefore, doctors told her mother: “Susan will never amount to anything, don't expect much from her.” In her autobiography, Susan said doctors shouldn't have made that comment. “What they didn't know is that I'm a fighter and have tried all my life to prove them wrong”. Susan Boyle gained international attention during a performance on the show “Britain's Got Talent”. Her first album “I Dreamed a Dream” (2009) broke sales records in the UK and totaled nearly 14 million copies sold worldwide. Susan won two Grammys and is known for supporting charitable causes.

ronaldo.title: Cristiano Ronaldo
ronaldo.text: When Maria Dolores discovered she was pregnant for the fourth time, she sought a doctor to perform an abortion. He, however, replied that there was no physical reason to abort and that this baby would bring her much joy in life. Without the doctor's complicity, Dolores tried other abortion methods that didn't work. Finally, she said “if God's will is for this child to be born, so be it!” During childbirth, the same doctor said a phrase that stayed forever in Dolores' memory: “With feet like these, he will be a soccer player!” In other consultations, the doctor seeing the mother's concern, encouraged her saying: “Rejoice, woman, this baby will bring you much luck in life and much happiness!” Cristiano is today the number 7 shirt for the Spanish club Real Madrid and is considered the greatest Portuguese soccer player of all time.

dion.title: Celine Dion
dion.text: The Canadian singer's mother was devastated to learn she was expecting Celine, her 14th child, and told a priest she intended to have an abortion; the priest then convinced her not to do it and to accept the baby. “I owe my life to this priest,” said the singer. “When my mother got over the disappointment, she didn't waste time on self-pity and loved me as passionately as my younger brother,” she declared.

bocelli.title: Andrea Bocelli
bocelli.text: When his mother was pregnant, she was hospitalized with appendicitis. Due to the treatment, doctors advised her to abort because the baby could be born with disabilities. Even so, the young mother refused and gave birth to Andrea Bocelli, who was born with a voice capable of moving audiences around the world.

silva.title: Thiago Silva
silva.text: Dona Angela, mother of soccer player Thiago Silva, said she thought about abortion. “I even cried on my father's lap saying I didn't want to have the abortion, but that I also couldn't afford to raise another child. But he wouldn't let me do that, commit a sin!”, said the mother. Of humble origin, Thiago grew up in the Santa Cruz favela, in the West Zone of Rio de Janeiro. Today, Dona Angela's youngest is considered one of the best (and most expensive) defenders in the world.

nicholson.title: Jack Nicholson
nicholson.text: At 17, June Frances Nicholson, despite being pressured by colleagues to abort, gave birth to a baby she named Jack. June left her son with her parents, John and Ethel, and the boy grew up believing his grandparents were his parents and June was his sister. Only after his mother's death did Nicholson discover his own story. “My only emotion is gratitude, literally, for my life. If June and Ethel had less character, I would never have lived. These women gave me the gift of life,” he said.

padre_pio.title: Padre Pio made a woman see the Pope she aborted
padre_pio.intro: "The child you killed in your womb with abortion, in God's designs, was meant to become this pope."
padre_pio.p1: In the life of St. Padre Pio of Pietrelcina there is this beautiful and interesting episode.
padre_pio.p2:
To a woman who went to his confessional, Padre Pio said:
“Close your eyes and tell me what you see.”
padre_pio.p3: The lady obeyed, closed her eyes and said: “I see a huge square with many people. Among the people, I see a procession moving solemnly. I see in the cloudy many priests, bishops and cardinals: all precede a pope who is taking the throne. Yes, I see precisely a pope on the throne (it was the gestatorial chair) and a large crowd cheering this pope, very beautiful … But what does all this mean?”
padre_pio.p4: Padre Pio replied: “The child you killed in your womb with abortion, in God's designs, was meant to become this pope”.
padre_pio.p5: The poor woman screamed and fainted beside the confessional.
padre_pio.source: (Taken from: E. Boninsegna, Ero curato, ora sono da curare, Verona, Professional Manuscript, 2019, page 139).

matheus.title: Moving testimony of a Priest who was almost aborted
matheus.intro: Testimony of Father Matheus Aquino, from the Archdiocese of São Sebastião do Rio de Janeiro.
matheus.p1: Father Matheus Aquino shares with deep humility and gratitude the miracle of his own life. In a touching account, he reveals how close he came to not being born, but how God's hand and his mother's courageous decision changed the destiny of his existence and led him to the priesthood.
matheus.p2: "I am the fruit of a 'yes' to life. If today I am a priest, if today I can serve the brothers and celebrate the Eucharist, it is because someone believed that my life had infinite value from conception."
matheus.p3: His story is a beacon of hope for so many mothers who, in moments of despair and uncertainty, consider abortion as the only way out. Father Matheus' testimony is a living reminder that we never know the wonders God has in store for every child He allows to be conceived.
matheus.p4: Watch the video above to hear the full account of this priest from Rio de Janeiro who today dedicates his life to proclaiming the Gospel of Life.

melissa.title: Her grandmother forced her mother to abort, but she survived
melissa.intro: In the eighth month of pregnancy she was forced to abort against her will. But the child growing in her womb had a purpose in life, beyond death.
melissa.p1: In the eighth month of pregnancy, a 19-year-old college student from Ohio (United States) was forced to abort against her will. But the child growing in her womb had a purpose in life, beyond death.
melissa.p2: The abortion was unsuccessful and a girl named Melissa was born. However, the newborn had to face another challenge.
melissa.p3: When an aborted child is born alive, abortionists are obliged to deny medical assistance so that it dies alone. But on this occasion a nurse defied this order and took Melissa to the hospital to receive proper care.
melissa.p4: Melissa weighed only two pounds and suffered from severe respiratory problems, doctors said she would have a life full of complications and there was no hope for her future.
melissa.p5: However, Melissa was adopted by a family who fought for her life. When she turned 14, her adoptive family explained to her that she was adopted. This news caused a radical change in her life.
melissa.p6: A new world of questions came to her mind: “I was surprised when my parents told me I was adopted. Who was my biological mother then? What were my roots? Where did I come from?”, she acknowledges.
melissa.p7: With so many unanswered questions, over the next few years the young woman began investigating adoption papers and medical records looking for clues that would lead her to her biological mother.
melissa.p8: After a long time struggling with bureaucratic hurdles, she discovered a truth that hid many secrets:
melissa.p9: “I discovered I had survived an abortion, but the story got complicated and as I investigated, I came across the harsh reality,” says Melissa.
melissa.p10: In fact, Melissa's biological mother had been forced to abort. The most surprising part of this story is knowing who forced her and committed this crime: Melissa's grandmother, a “nurse” who worked at a place that performed abortions and didn't hesitate to organize everything to kill her own granddaughter before birth, in the eighth month of pregnancy.
melissa.p11: Her grandmother's cruelty knew no bounds. Upon discovering the baby had survived the abortion, she left her in a room to die alone. It was the kindness of another nurse that saved her. Without the grandmother noticing, she called an ambulance to transfer the newborn to a hospital.
melissa.p12: But there was a second secret in this story, Melissa's biological mother didn't know her daughter had survived the abortion. She was told she had died and for all those years had lived tormented by having killed her baby.
melissa.p13: When Melissa learned the terrible story of her birth, she experienced a struggle within herself. “I didn't want to tell anyone, I was ashamed and at the same time angry, I lived desolate for years because of it. But I realized that if I didn't tell, my biological mother would never know I was alive,” she tells Fox News.
melissa.p14: It took several years to experience true forgiveness. Thanks to her Christian faith she managed to overcome the trauma of her birth, even managing to get in touch with her biological mother.
melissa.p15: “Now I know my grandmother wanted to change my destiny so I wouldn't be in the world. For some reason, my birth and adoption were a secret to everyone. But I can't keep this secret anymore. I want to tell my story to help save millions of babies who are aborted every year. I want to help mothers make the decision to bet on their children's lives,” continues Melissa.
melissa.p16: Abortion is a human rights issue, which is why this survivor is part of the pro-life movement in the United States.
melissa.p17: “I once read a statistic that said every abortion affects seven people, not just the mother, but the father, grandparents, siblings... If 58 million abortions were performed in the last 44 years, that equals at least 406 million people who suffered the consequences of an abortion”.
melissa.p18: Thus, Melissa launched a message of encouragement to the pro-life community that is being persecuted. “To people who mock and ridicule human life I can only show love, we can love people, but not share their way of thinking, even if they don't believe life has unique value,” she states.
melissa.p19: Melissa also criticized Planned Parenthood, the leading abortion provider in the United States. “I am sure if they had taken my mother to abort at the Planned Parenthood center I wouldn't have survived: there is no mercy there. And even if I had survived the abortion, they would do everything so I wouldn't be alive,” she sentences.
melissa.p20: Now, Melissa Ohden is the author of several books in which she speaks about forgiveness and the meaning of life. In addition, she created the website “The Abortion Survivors”, a community so that people who survived an abortion can find psychological and social help.
melissa.p21: In her personal life, Melissa formed her own family. She is the mother of two daughters and the eldest, Olivia, was born in the same hospital where she was cared for after surviving the abortion.

tong.title: Man has already adopted over 100 children who would have been aborted
tong.intro: Vietnamese Tong Phuoc Phuc is another wonderful example of real-life heroes! If it weren't for him, over a hundred children would have been aborted in his country.
tong.p1: Vietnamese Tong Phuoc Phuc is another wonderful example of real-life heroes! If it weren't for him, over a hundred children would have been aborted in his country. Yes, he is the father of dozens of children who might never have been born.
tong.p2: This love story began in 2001, when Phuc's wife was pregnant and had many complications. During the delivery, which was extremely difficult, Phuc saw that many of the women entering the nearby room left there without their babies.
tong.p3: He didn't really understand why at first. Only later did Phuc realize the children had been aborted, upon seeing doctors throwing fetuses in the trash. Phuc was moved by what he saw and asked to take the bodies home.
tong.p4: With a humble life, he gathered all his savings from his work as a builder to buy a field where he could bury the remains of the babies that were thrown in the trash. Phuc's wife found it all very strange at first, to the point of thinking her husband had gone mad. Even so, he continued and today, over 10,000 fetuses rest in peace in the field bought by him.
tong.p5: Since then, mothers who aborted children visit the cemetery to pray for their children. In addition, pregnant women at risk of abortion began to seek Phuc for help. He then opened the doors of his home to receive them and offered to adopt the babies they couldn't raise.
tong.p6: Phuc keeps the little ones until the mothers are able to take care of them on their own.
tong.subtitle: Names with Meaning
tong.p7: The boys adopted by him are named Vihn (meaning “Honor”), and the girls are named Tam (meaning “Heart”). The second name is always the mother's or her city of origin - in case the mother returns to pick her up.
tong.p8: The surname is Phuc himself, as he considers everyone as if they were his children. Phuc says “these children now have a safe home. I am willing to help and teach them to be good people”.
tong.p9: Caring for over a hundred children is not an easy task, but Phuc doesn't intend to stop here. He declared he will continue “this work until my last breath of life, and I encourage my children to continue helping other underprivileged people”.
